Package org.neo4j.internal.batchimport.cache

Interface NumberArrayFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ChunkedNumberArrayFactory, NumberArrayFactory.Adapter, NumberArrayFactory.Auto, PageCachedNumberArrayFactory
    public interface NumberArrayFactory
    Factory of LongArray, IntArray and ByteArray instances. Users can select in which type of memory the arrays will be placed, either in HEAP, OFF_HEAP, or use an auto allocator which will have each instance placed where it fits best, favoring the primary candidates.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  NumberArrayFactory.Adapter
      Implements the dynamic array methods, because they are the same in most implementations.
      static class  NumberArrayFactory.AllocationFailure  
      static class  NumberArrayFactory.Auto
      Looks at available memory and decides where the requested array fits best.
      static interface  NumberArrayFactory.Monitor  

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static NumberArrayFactory AUTO_WITHOUT_PAGECACHE
      NumberArrayFactory.Auto factory which uses JVM stats for gathering information about available memory.
      static NumberArrayFactory CHUNKED_FIXED_SIZE
      Used as part of the fallback strategy for NumberArrayFactory.Auto.
      static NumberArrayFactory HEAP
      Puts arrays inside the heap.
      static NumberArrayFactory.Monitor NO_MONITOR  
      static NumberArrayFactory OFF_HEAP
      Puts arrays off-heap, using unsafe calls.

    • Field Detail

      • NO_MONITOR

        static final NumberArrayFactory.Monitor NO_MONITOR

      • HEAP

        static final NumberArrayFactory HEAP
        Puts arrays inside the heap.

      • OFF_HEAP

        static final NumberArrayFactory OFF_HEAP
        Puts arrays off-heap, using unsafe calls.

      • CHUNKED_FIXED_SIZE

        static final NumberArrayFactory CHUNKED_FIXED_SIZE
        Used as part of the fallback strategy for NumberArrayFactory.Auto. Tries to split up fixed-size arrays (newLongArray(long, long, MemoryTracker) and newIntArray(long, int, MemoryTracker) into smaller chunks where some can live on heap and some off heap.

      • AUTO_WITHOUT_PAGECACHE

        static final NumberArrayFactory AUTO_WITHOUT_PAGECACHE
        NumberArrayFactory.Auto factory which uses JVM stats for gathering information about available memory.

    • Method Detail

      • auto

        static NumberArrayFactory auto​(PageCache pageCache,
                               PageCacheTracer pageCacheTracer,
                               Path dir,
                               boolean allowHeapAllocation,
                               NumberArrayFactory.Monitor monitor)
        NumberArrayFactory.Auto factory which has a page cache backed number array as final fallback, in order to prevent OOM errors.
        Parameters:
        pageCache - PageCache to fallback allocation into, if no more memory is available.
        pageCacheTracer - underlying page cache events tracer
        dir - directory where cached files are placed.
        allowHeapAllocation - whether or not to allow allocation on heap. Otherwise allocation is restricted to off-heap and the page cache fallback. This to be more in control of available space in the heap at all times.
        monitor - for monitoring successful and failed allocations and which factory was selected.
        Returns:
        a NumberArrayFactory which tries to allocation off-heap, then potentially on heap and lastly falls back to allocating inside the given pageCache.

      • allocationAlternatives

        static NumberArrayFactory[] allocationAlternatives​(boolean allowHeapAllocation,
                                                   NumberArrayFactory... additional)
        Parameters:
        allowHeapAllocation - whether or not to include heap allocation as an alternative.
        additional - other means of allocation to try after the standard off/on heap alternatives.
        Returns:
        an array of NumberArrayFactory with the desired alternatives.

      • newIntArray

        default IntArray newIntArray​(long length,
                             int defaultValue,
                             MemoryTracker memoryTracker)
        Parameters:
        length - size of the array.
        defaultValue - value which will represent unset values.
        memoryTracker - underlying buffers allocation memory tracker
        Returns:
        a fixed size IntArray.

        Parameters:

        defaultValue - value which will represent unset values.
        memoryTracker - underlying buffers allocation memory tracker
        Returns:
        dynamically growing IntArray.
